CatDescriptText: Lelia Lee, 3365 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "I hope not. I doubt very much that things will become as severe as that of the '30s.  The reason- well, I'm just an optimistic person and feel that things will brighten up."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lelia Lee wearing dark hat with brooch, beaded necklace, plaid scarf, and light colored coat with shawl collar, holding handbag and bag in left arm, standing with reporter's hand holding notepad on right in front of marble with store window with Valentine cards on left
